All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Command
Represents an abstract command that can be executed within the game.
CommandErrorException
Represents an exception thrown when an unrecognized or invalid command is encountered.
CommandType
Represents the various types of commands that can be executed in the game.
Container
Represents a conatiner in the game, which is a type of feature that may contain items or serve as an interactable object within a room.
Drop
Represents the drop command, allowing the player to drop an item from their inventory into the current room.
Equipment
 
Exit
Represents an exit in the game, allowing the player to move from one room to another.
Feature
Represents a feature in the game, which is a type of game object that can be part of a room or environment.
Game
Main class for the game application.
GameObject
Represents a generic game object that can be part of the game world.
GameState
Represents the current state of the game, including the map and the player.
GameStateFileParser
Utility class for parsing a game state from a file.
Get
Represents the get command, allowing the player to pick up an item from the current room and add it to their inventory.
Help
Represents the help command, providing the player with instructions or information about various topics related to the game.
Item
Represents an item in the game, which is a type of GameObject.
Look
Represents the look command, allowing the player to examine various elements of the game world.
Map
Represents the game map, which consists of a collection of rooms and the current room the player is in.
Move
Represents the move command, allowing the player to navigate to a different room in the game world.
Player
Represents the player in the game, including their name, inventory, and equipment.
Quit
Represents the quit command, allowing the player to exit the game.
Room
Represents a room in the game, which is a type of GameObject.
Status
Represents the status command, allowing the player to retrieve information about their inventory, specific items, or their overall status.
Usable
Represents an interface for objects that can be used within the game.
Use
Represents the use command, allowing the player to use equipment on a specific target in the game.
UseInformation
Represents information about how an object can be used in the game.
